summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from July 2020 between FBI personnel, primarily from the New York office and the Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit at FBIHQ, discussing travel approval and logistical planning for the arrest of a target (understood to be Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The emails detail cost estimates, shifting location intelligence from Massachusetts to New Hampshire, and the need to move technical assets.

persons.name: Leonard F Bolton

events.title: Location intelligence shift for Maxwell
events.description: Historical phone data indicates the target (Maxwell) is in New Hampshire, necessitating a shift in operational planning from Massachusetts.

events.description: Approval granted for travel expenses for an FBI team to arrest the target (Maxwell), including costs for personnel, lodging, and per diem.

events.title: Plan to move technical assets
events.description: Discussion of potentially moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone, indicating active electronic surveillance.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020, with location intelligence shifting from Massachusetts to New Hampshire based on historical phone data.
The operation involved a team of approximately four FBI personnel from New York, with detailed travel and expense approvals being coordinated.
The FBI considered moving technical surveillance assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone, indicating the use of electronic tracking methods.

The correspondence shows direct coordination between the FBI New York field office and the FBI Headquarters' Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit for operational approval and notification.

The target of the arrest operation, though not explicitly named in the text, is contextually understood to be Ghislaine Maxwell, based on the reference to the 'Epstein investigation' and the timing aligning with her actual arrest on July 2, 2020.
